New Records: Pete Alonso is now the first player in MLB history to hit a go-ahead home run while trailing in the ninth inning or later of a winner-take-all playoff game.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead three-run opposite-field line drive in the ninth inning.
Devin Williams hit Jesse Winker with a fastball, who then stole second base and scored on a single from Starling Marte.
David Peterson induced a game-ending double play ball to Francisco Lindor.
Post-Match Reflections: Time will tell whether Alonso's dramatic home run will be the start of a possible Mets run to the World Series.
The Mets' comeback victory in the decisive Game 3 gave them their first playoff series win since claiming the NL pennant in 2015.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Every team to have eliminated the Brewers from the playoffs has gone on to reach the Fall Classic.
New York will face the Philadelphia Phillies in the NLDS, marking the first time the two fierce rivals have ever met in the postseason.
